member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT
member.summary: The RECT structure defines a rectangle by the coordinates of its upper-left and lower-right corners.

remarks.para: The RECT structure is identical to the RECTL structure.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT.left
member.summary: Specifies the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT.top
member.summary: Specifies the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT.right
member.summary: Specifies the x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT.bottom
member.summary: Specifies the y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.SetWindowPos(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND,Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.SET_WINDOW_POS_FLAGS)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a child, pop-up, or top-level window. These windows are ordered according to their appearance on the screen. The topmost window receives the highest rank and is the first window in the Z order.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: Type: HWND A handle to the window.

param.name: X
param.para: Type: int The new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.

param.name: Y
param.para: Type: int The new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.

param.name: cx
param.para: Type: int The new width of the window, in pixels.

param.name: cy
param.para: Type: int The new height of the window, in pixels.

returns.para: Type: BOOL If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.GetWindowRect(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND,Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT*)
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: Type: HWND A handle to the window.

param.name: lpRect
param.para: Type: LPRECT A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.

returns.para: Type: BOOL If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.
